meanings.definition: To lower in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was declassing the student for misbehaving in class.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to declass a few employees due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent3: The magician declassed the rabbit to the level of a mere prop in his show.
meanings.sent4: The storm declassed the once mighty tree to a pile of broken branches.
meanings.sent5: The king's decision to declass the knight left the kingdom in shock.

meanings.definition: The act of reducing in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: The declassing of the general surprised the entire army.
meanings.sent2: After the declassing, he had to adjust to his new position in the company.
meanings.sent3: The declassing of the celebrity's social media account caused quite a stir online.
meanings.sent4: The declassing of the painting to a mere replica disappointed art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The declassing of the athlete from champion to amateur was a hard blow to his ego.
